headline: Good-for-You Greek Salad
description: This tomato and cucumber salad with feta is light but has big taste packed into every bite, thanks to briny olives and a fresh sprinkling of lemon juice.

video.description: This Greek Salad is light and refreshing with excellent salty elements!
video.name: Good for You Greek Salad

name: Good-for-You Greek Salad
recipeIngredient: 6 black Greek olives, pitted and sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Toss tomatoes, cucumbers, and red onion together in a shallow salad bowl. Drizzle oil and lemon juice over top, then sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper. Top with feta and olives.

review.reviewBody: Make this often. We rarely eat salads with lettuce anymore.
I made this salad with apple cider vinegar instead of lemon juice. I whipped the oil, vinegar salt, pepper and oregano until creamy and poured it over the salad. Very good recipe!
Simple and delicious. What else do you want?

I made this salad last night. It was delicious and filling! It actually kept me from overeating the main course as I had two healthy bowlfuls. This is definitely going to be one of my go-to salads!! Thanks for sharing!!
A wonderful cool refreshing salad.
This is absolutely delicious! I've made this a ton of times. The dressing is perfect, I also use it for a Greek-pasta dish (using a box of rotini pasta, 1.5 times this recipe, add shrimp).
Absolutely delicious! My family loves it!
Hope it last till dinner time!!
Perfect. Simple and easy
Great recipe.
Added poblano and regular olives as I didn’t have the others on hand!
Hubby loved it,
Never thought to add oregano. Was delicious!

I will definitely make this again. Nice and light. I did use cherry tomatoes because that was all I had, but I think that helped make it less soupy. I also used the small, snack-size cucumbers. Again, that makes it less soupy and the cukes are nice and crispy. I'd add more Greek olives, but I'm a big olive fan.
Lovely salad! Definitely substitute kalamata for the black olives but otherwise so delicious with falafel and pita tonight!
Fresh and flavorful side dish, perfect for summertime.

Made it as is but omitted the olives since we aren’t fans of olives. We all loved it! My children even raves about it. It is light and refreshing; perfect for potluck picnics! Fast and easy to make too :)
What a great tasting, healthy salad! I finished it off the next morning with a fried egg on toast. It was a great start to my day.
Perfect marinade
Delicious! Easy and VERY tasty recipe! I didn't mix in the onions cuz my oldest doesn't like them but left them on the side for the rest of us to enjoy....AND WE DID! We ALL this salad!

Refreshing. Perfect in pita bread for lunch. I made it exactly as written. EDIT TO ADD: I made it a second time. This time I added a tsp of lime juice, a clove of garlic, and extra salt to make up for not having the salty feta cheese. I served it on salty tortilla chips. Still very good, even without the cheese.

This was wonderful. I made one alteration, I used stuffed green olives with feta. WH does not like cucumbers so I shared with my sister's and they also loved it.. I will be making this for our sisters weekends. Thanks for sharing...
Wonderful! I also added 2 T Red Wine Vinegar for the Lemon Juice.
Simple quick and really tasty!

I added 1 Tbspn of distilled white vinegar to this recipe only because the salads like this in the North Texas are are prepared like this and it was amazing. My guests plowed through it and although I doubled the recipe some ate this by itself in lieu of the giant cheeseburgers I cooked over hickory. I would absolutely recommend this recipe...vinegar or not.
This was excellent I made it as written but added 1 teaspoon of red wine vinegar. Got rave reviews from my guests

We had it per the recipe and loved it. Made it again this time used a Tuscan herb blend and added some cooked shrimp! It was great again...love recipe's that you can so easily add to! My wife took some up to her 85 year old mother who called it one of the best things we ever made for her.

Came out great! I like someone suggested only put in 3T fresh lemon juice and 1T of red wine vinegar. I also added in the oregano,salt and pepper with the mix, tossed and refrigerated covered for a few hours. I used Mediterranean flavored feta.
My family loves it!! Great summer side dish
Absolutely delicious! Almost exactly like the Greek salad I get when I go out to a Greek restaurant an hour from my house. Yum.
Tastes great. Followed the recipe as stated and it came out fantastic.
Love, love, love this salad. Followed the recipe as written. Didn't think I liked Feta cheese until I tried it on this salad.
Does not keep well
Added avocado, forgot the lemon juice. Still very good side for chicken and pesto.
I don’t use the lemon juice, but overall a super tasty dish my family loves!
Very delicious and easy. The dressing needed tweaking: added red wine vinegar, salt and a bit of sugar to taste.

Thank you for sharing! This recipe is delicious, even the kids love it. I have made it exactly as is, or sometimes I substitute the lemon juice with balsamic vinegar, it tastes great using either one.
I added lettuce and instead used greek seasoning.
A very good salad I would replace the Feta cheese with Bulgarian Cheese, put a pinch of salt and a bit of pepper and its really tasty everyone cleaned their bowls

I enjoyed this as a base - I added in more flavor and it was still a little bland. I did add in a handful of spinach and 2 cans of albacore tuna, so I can have it as a stand alone meal. Perhaps swap Mediterranean flavored feta cheese, basil and add Italian seasoning/dressing packet. lots of creative options and makes enough for me to take to work for a couple of days. Refreshing. Thanks for the share!
I made this, and it came out so delicious!!! Super easy and simple
Spiraled the cucumber into noodles, julienned the carrots, added garlic buttered shrimp (basically scampi), olives and pepperoni to make this salad...... Awesome!
Simple and delicious. The whole family enjoyed it!
This was amazing. You can reduce the calories even more by cutting back on the oil, cheese and olives. It will be a new staple in our house.
Very good salad, I added cauliflower as I had some on hand, yummy!
doh MBOP

This salad was exceptionally good!! I pretty much stayed true to the recipe too. Only variances: I had to use Bleu cheese stuffed green olives because the store was out of kalamatas and I completely forgot the dried oregano until this am! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

Had to make do with what I had around, so yellow onion and Italian shredded cheese, but that's not too bad. Also used fresh Asian basil instead of oregano. Very flavorful and very easy. Two of my favorite things!
I did not change a thing. Even the meat lovers had seconds.
Used fresh oregano leaves instead of dried and used a mix of the green and white part of the scallions. Very yummy.
Very good basic recipe. Simple is great! I shall maybe tweak the dressing with a few more spices. Excellent summer side!
Excellent! My friends all love it. I use English cucumbers and don't peel them -- sometimes I slice the onion in very thin rings.
Love it!

This salad is fantastic. I now make it about every three days and have some every day, and will continue to do so as long as fresh vegetables are available at the local Farmers' Market. 

Although perfect as is, I add more olives--an entire can of black greek, and an entire jar of Kalamata, chopped. I also add dill along with the oregano. 

I sometimes add grilled chicken, which is awesome with this salad. Can't get enough of it! Thank you!

We thought this was an excellent, light side dish to our meal. I removed the seeds from both the tomatoes & cucumber & gave them lots of time to drain after dicing. I don't ordinarily like raw tomatoes & onions, but I'll eat them in this dish! We will make this again. Thank you for the recipe.
For my partner who hates cucumbers, it was easy to replace those with lettuce. A wonderful potluck recipe: Throw the produce into a bag and quickly assemble at the venue!
It was delicious everyone loved it!

I love this recipe. I eat this as a meal or a snack. 
I use a little less onion and add whole Kalamata olives. 
In a pinch, sub the seasonings for Italian salad dressing. Quick and easy! 
Also, if you let this sit, the tomatoes will start to break down. If you don't like the liquid, either drain it or eat it right away.
Love me some greek salad and this one was just right. Thank you!

I have made this numerous times now although usually for two people so I adjust the quantities. I don't typically change a thing otherwise although it is a salad so easy to swap an item or two or throw in an extra. I don't think it needs it. What I like about it is that it is so quick to prepare and that it isn't full of lettuce or kale of spinach or any other leaf like most salads available in the grocery store. You don't feel like a rabbit eating this one.

I have made this numerous times now although usually for two people so I adjust the quantities. I don't typically change a thing otherwise although it is a salad so easy to swap an item or two or throw in an extra. I don't think it needs it. What I like about it is that it is so quick to prepare and that it isn't full of lettuce or kale of spinach or any other leaf like most salads available in the grocery store. You don't feel like a rabbit eating this one.
Easy recipe that taught me to make Greek salad, thank you.

We enjoyed this salad, I had some Romaine lettuce to use up so I placed that on the bottom, then the rest of the ingredients on top, I also mixed the salad dressing up in the morning to let it sit, I added a pinch of sugar as I found it a little acidic.
#Allrecipesallstarscanada
#Cleaneats

I added 1/3 of the onion it called for because I was using really flavorful heirloom tomatoes and didn't want the onion overpowering it. I also served the olives on the side because 1/2 of our kiddos don't like kalamata olives (weird, I know) thanks for a quick and easy yet tasty recipe.
I added an avocado. My whole family LOVED this salad. Will definitely be making this on a regular basis.
Recipe has everything a great Caesar salad should have. Frequently requested for family dinners.
Awesome, I'll make this again and again.
excellent..the fresh lemon juice really does the trick!
Love Love Love this one!!!
Made a 1/2 batch with some left over veggies. Total win at the party I took it too.

I made this tonight for my brother and I and we both loved it! Didn't make any changes (except garnishing with coriander) as the recipe was just perfect! We didn't have naan so used chappati instead which just as good. Will definitely make this again =]
Made it as-is, and it was so good! I was a little scared to try it because I'm not a huge fan of olives, cucumbers, or tomatoes, but everything went together so well! Mmmm! So simple and so healthy!

This is a very good, healthy recipe! I made a few alterations. 
 I used an English cucumber (scooped out the seeds), halved cherry tomatoes, kalamata olives and crumbled gorgonzola cheese.
Otherwise I followed the recipe as given. I will be making this again!
Made it for a girls night in. Tasty!
fabulous taste. used tomatos and cukes from my garden!!! family loved it.
Very light and tasty. All my guests loved it AND the very little that was left over was just as good the next day. It's a keeper.

Excellent recipe, and it didn't last long in our house! I added half of a chopped green pepper as one reviewer recommended, and substituted 2 tbsp of lemon juice for 2 tbsp of red wine vinegar. (so I used 2 tbsp fresh lemon juice and 2 tbsp red wine vinegar.) I used garden fresh ingredients and kalamata olives in place of black olives. Delicious!

So good! The adjustments I made were to add a small amount of red and yellow peppers, I cut the amount of lemon juice a little and added a little red wine vinegar, and I used Greek Seasoning (that's what it's called) instead of pepper. 

I couldn't wait to eat it but I'll bet it's better on day two.

I made this salad to accompany Chef John's Greek Lemon Chicken and Potatoes that I made for dinner tonight, and it went perfect with it! I really just eye-balled the ingredients, and used white wine vinegar in place of the lemon juice. Refreshing summer side salad, and one that I'll make again.
Followed the suggestions and used red wine vinegar instead of lemon juice and loved it! So light and fresh.
I left out the feta and substituted the black olives for kalamata. The oregano really makes this salad. SO GOOD.
I did not use any onion or olives and added lettuce. The flavour was fantastic. I used fresh oregano.

First of all I feel you can't really rate a recipe if you don't follow it. I'm all for being creative in cooking but I always try to make it as directed first. And that's what I did. It was very flavorful. Only reason I gave it 4 stars is because mine got super watery. I brought it to a BBQ and it was like soup on the bottom when I got there. Not sure what I did wrong. I will try this again for sure!
absolutely delicious.
My only change to it was to add more than 6 olives - but I love olives!
Great recipe, I had added Quinoa and left out the black olives, worked wonderfully! If you have left overs and need to made the salad wet again, Garlic Expressions worked out great!

Make it a real Greek salad: lose the black olives; use calamata greek olives' and add finely chopped sweet basil, mint and touch of oregano, and of course use good quality feta cheese. Also red peppers are always better than green peppers. Greek or Italian dressing made with real extra virgin olive oil ok, with a touch of lemon juice. otherwise, not bad for "Gringos".
This is a keeper. Great flavor
This is a keeper. Great flavor

I love this - I love it SO much that I've made it three times in two weeks and ate it all myself. I did split the amount of lemon juice with red wine vinegar and tend to add any extra veggies I have on hand (celery works really well) but can't thank you enough for the recipe. It's wonderful!
(I wonder how some Louisiana muffuletta olive salad would work in place of the olives........I guess I'll give it a shot next time)
Wonderful! I used 3T lemon juice and 1T red wine vinegar. Keeper!!

This is delicious! I used english cucumbers(personal preference) and also added a few whole peperocini peppers to the mix. My hubby can't get enough of this he loves it! Thanks Jen for sumitting your recipe. Elvira Silva.

This is really good!!!!! My greek salad sucked because I put literally no dressing on (dumb, I know..) and I thought to myself...why don't I go onto allrecipes...this recipe caught my eye! I will be making it over and over again...I just copied it into my cookbook!
Great summer salad all year long...light fresh & goes well with so many dishes, pretty too! ;)
Delicious and easy to make.

Wowza! This salad was delicious, refreshing and filling! I added 2 teaspoons of lemon juice and 2 teaspoons of red wine vinegar. This is a restaurant quality recipe and we will be making this regularly!
Not the best dressing but definitely good. Its worth trying the tweaks that other reviewers have mentioned. Will be making it again.

Great just as the recipe calls for! For an added twist you can add chilled beets, banana peppers or hot peppers. I use this salad for our "salad day" of the week and it never gets boring. We do sometimes drop the oil and lemon and use a great greek dressing.
One of my favourite salads.
